content:
• Tuesday, January 8, 2019
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries to cut quarterly dividend to $0.01

    • Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) -4.5% after-hours as it slashes its quarterly dividend by 83% reduction to $0.01/share.
    • NBR says the move, plus targeting $400M in capital spending and optimizing G&A and R&E expenses via a 10% Y/Y reduction, are part of its plan to reduce net debt by $200M-$250M during 2019.
    • NBR says it reduced net debt by $230M to $3.12B and total debt by $150M to $3.59B in Q4, based on preliminary information.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • SNE

    Report: Sony considers moving China production if tariffs rise

    • Sony (NYSE:SNE) will consider moving some production out of China if the U.S. goes forward with higher tariffs, Nikkei reports.
    • That's according to senior executive VP Ichiro Takagi, who told reporters at CES that "of course" they'd consider moving that capacity to other regions if tariffs rise to 25%.
    • Sony has exposure via video cameras it makes on the mainland, and Takagi says that in the consumer market, a stock decline has cut into disposable income and hit purchases of high-end goods, but the company will hold the line on prices.
    • Shares have risen 2.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • XSPA

    XpresSpa jumps 33% as Calm completes $3M investment

    • XpresSpa (NASDAQ:XSPA) is up 32.7% in late trading after its update that Calm has wrapped a $3M investment in the company.
    • It issued that amount in preferred equity, convertible at $0.62/share -- a heavy premium to today's closing price of $0.18/share.
    • The two entered a strategic deal in November, at which time Calm -- an app for sleep, meditation and relaxation -- funded $2M of the $3M commitment.
    • At closing, XpresSpa's market cap was just $5.76M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • JCP

    JCPenney +3.3% after guidance/holiday sales update

    • JCPenney (NYSE:JCP) is slightly higher after hours, +3.3% on solid volume, after issuing a holiday sales update and reaffirmed some guidance for fiscal 2018.
    • The company says comparable-store sales for the nine-week period ended Jan. 5 fell 3.5% on a shifted basis; on an unshifted basis, comp sales fell 5.4%.
    • It reaffirmed guidance for positive free cash flow in fiscal 2018, to reduce inventory by more than $225M (8%) and says it expects to end the year with liquidity in excess of $2B.
    • JCPenney will initiate three preliminary store closings this spring, and will share more information on closings when it reports Q4 on Feb. 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 52 Comments
  • VIRT

    Virtu +8.1% after issuing preliminary Q4 revenue of $424M-$447M

    • Virtu Financial (NASDAQ:VIRT) jumps 8.1% in after-hours trading after reporting estimated Q4 total revenue of $424M-$447M.
    • Trading income, net $350M-$364M and adjusted net trading income $285M-$298M.
    • Net income of $100M-$129M.
    • Adjusted EBITDA of $180M-$195M.
    • Previously: Goldman favors alternative asset manager, exchanges (Jan. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEO

    NeoGenomics +8.4% on move to SmallCap 600

    • Cancer-focused NeoGenomics (NASDAQ:NEO) is up 8.4% after hours on word it's moving into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It's replacing Engility Holdings (NYSE:EGL), set to be acquired by MidCap 400 firm Science Applications International.
    • The move is effective prior to the open on Monday, Jan. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM

  • Gundlach says "get out" of junk bonds

    • DoubleLine founder and CEO Jeffrey Gundlach sees "real potential for negative surprises" in corporate credit.
    • "Investors need to go to strong balance sheets. This will be the way to survive the zigzag of 2019."
    • He recommends getting out of junk bonds. "Use the strength of junk bonds as a gift and get out of them," he said.
    • The S&P 500 could zigzag for much of the year, and he sees a kind of tug-of-war between stocks and bonds.
    • As for the 2s10s yield curve, "I'm of the belief that the yield curve will steepen."
    • Emerging markets will outperform the S&P 500 if the dollar weakens and he expects the dollar to weaken.
    • "I still think Europe is a value trap."
    • With "an explosion of national debt in a growing economy," Gundlach asks, "Are we really growing at all, or is it just all debt-based?"
    • Doesn't recommend anything on Bitcoin, but "Bitcoin can easily make it to $5,000."
    • High-yield ETFs: HYG, JNK, DHY, HIX, EAD, PHT, HYT, HYLD, JQC, ACP, ANGL, CIK, MCI, DSU, SJB, KIO, NHS, CIF, ARDC, IVH, GGM, AIF, MPV, FHY
    • Yield-curve ETFs: STPP, FLAT
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 85 Comments
  • VIRT

    VIRT, MSI, SGH and TLND among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: VIRT +8.1%. MSI +7.1%. PEG +6.8%. PHG +5.9%. CGC +5.3%.
    • Top Losers: SGH -12.2%. TLND -9.2%. RNG -6.1%. USX -5.3%. OTC:SVVTF -5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • CMP

    Compass Minerals says Q4 sales, earnings hurt by lower snow activity

    • Compass Minerals (NYSE:CMP) -4% after-hours as it reports Q4 sales of ~2.8M tons of highway deicing salt products vs. 3M tons sold in the year-ago quarter, while sales of all salt products totaled 3.5M tons in Q4 compared to 3.6M tons a year ago.
    • CMP says nearly 70% of snow events reported in Q4 occurred in November when temperatures are generally warmer, which reduces deicing salt needs, and it estimates these variances from average winter weather hurt sales in the quarter by $16M-$18M and operating earnings by $6M-$8M.
    • CMP also says efforts to improve production with the continuous mining and haulage systems at its Goderich mine are "driving better results."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 25 Comments
  • SWKS

    Apple supplier Skyworks cuts Q1 guidance

    • Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) cuts its Q1 forecast citing unit weakness across its largest smartphone clients. The revenue outlook now stands at $970M (prior: $1B to $1.02B) with EPS of $1.81 to $1.84 (prior: $1.91 at midpoint).
    • Apple recently cut its already soft guidance for the holiday quarter on soft iPhone sales and Samsung blamed its Q4 weakness, in part, on smartphone competition.
    • Skyworks will report earnings on February 5.
    • Skyworks shares are up 2% aftermarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 20 Comments
  • SGH

    SMART Global -11.6% on mixed Q1, downside guide

    • SMART Global (NASDAQ:SGH) plunges 11.6% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat revenue estimates with 48% Y/Y growth to $393.9M but missed on EPS. Downside Q2 guidance has revenue of $310M to $325M (consensus: $326.22M) and EPS of $0.73 to $0.77 (consensus: $1.27).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: SMART Global Q1 2019 Earnings Preview (Jan. 7)
    • Previously: SMART Global misses by $0.02, beats on revenue (Jan. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 16 Comments
  • USX

    U.S. Xpress makes comeback bid

    • U.S. Xpress Enterprises (NYSE:USX) ends the day with a gain of 11.8%.
    • While the transportation sector had a solid session on the whole, USX was given an extra lift when Morgan Stanley named it one of its top trucking/logistics picks for 2019.
    • Shares of U.S. Express are still down more than 40% over the last 90 days. Last week, Seeking Alpha contributor Hawkinvest pitched the case for a run by USX back to $15.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • TLRY

    Tilray and Canopy Growth recommended as Piper starts coverage

    • Piper Jaffray is launching coverage on a couple of marijuana names, initiating Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) and Canopy Growth (NYSE:CGC) at Overweight.
    • The $90 price target on Tilray suggests 8% upside. The $40 price target on Canopy Growth suggests 35% upside.
    • Tilray is up 0.8% after hours, and Canopy up 2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 63 Comments
  • NYMT

    New York Mortgage raising capital; shares down 3.1%

    • The company is selling 10.5M shares, with underwriter greenshoe for up to another 1.575M shares.
    • It's New York Mortgage's (NASDAQ:NYMT) 2nd equity raise in two months. September 30 book value per share was $5.72. Today's close was $6.12.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares -3.1% after hours to $5.93.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 13 Comments
  • MGY

    Magnolia Oil started with Buy ratings at Oppenheimer, Johnson Rice

    • Magnolia Oil & Gas (MGY +2.5%) moves higher after Oppenheimer starts coverage with an Outperform rating and $15 price target, with analyst Tim rezvan calling the company's free cash flow yield thesis "unique, compelling and sustainable."
    • Rezvan says he especially likes MGY's seasoned management team, productive asset base and prudent growth strategy.
    • Also, Johnson Rice initiates MGY with a Buy rating and $17 price target, citing the company's differentiated business model, steady organic production growth and reinvestments to maximize shareholder returns.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CKPT

    Checkpoint Therapeutics up 22% on advancement of lead I-O candidate

    • Thinly traded nano cap Checkpoint Therapeutics (CKPT +21.8%) is up on modestly higher volume. Shares have rallied 84% since touching $1.50 on December 24, 2018.
    • Yesterday, it announced the expansion of a Phase 1 study of lead immuno-oncology (I-O) candidate CK-301 to include three cohorts of patients with rapidly mutating tumors that it says will support requests for accelerated approval and U.S. marketing applications. The three:
    • Microsatellite instability-high (MSI-H) endometrial cancer that has progressed following one or two prior anti-cancer therapies.
    • Microsatellite stable (MSS) endometrial cancer that has progressed following one or two prior anti-cancer therapies.
    • MSI-H or mismatch repair deficient (dMMR) colorectal cancer that has progressed on or after, or been intolerant of, previous treatments, including a fluoropyrimidine- and oxaliplatin- and irinotecan-based chemotherapy.
    • The ongoing study is recruiting patients with non-small cell lung cancer and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma.
    • CK-301, a checkpoint inhibitor, is a fully-human monoclonal IgG1 antibody that blocks the interaction between PD-L1 and PD-1 and certain receptors called B7.1.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • DELL

    Dell unveils Alienware, XPS webcam fix

    • Dell (NYSE:DELL) comes to #CES19 with new Alienware and G Series products for gamers and XPS and Inspiron updates:
    • Dell dubs the Alienware Area-51m "the world's most powerful gaming laptop" and that comes with 9th Gen 8-core desktop processors, 64GB of memory, 2.5Gbps Ethernet, and a 17" Alienware laptop with a narrow-bezel display with 144Hz. Dell says the model offers 50% more performance and 32% less volume than its predecessor.
    • The Alienware m15 and new m17 are lightweight (as little as 4.76 pounds) and include 8th Gen Intel Core i5 and i7 processors and Nvidia's GeForce RTX 20 Series GPUs.
    • G Series gets the G5 15 and G7 8th Gen Intel CFL-H quad- and hex core processors, Nvidia graphics, and the option of a 144Hz refresh rate.
    • The gaming models are all available on January 29 with prices varying (see the list here.)
    • The new XPS 13 has the 8th Gen Whiskey Lake processor support for Dolby Vision, and a white color option. Most importantly, the update corrects the awkward webcam placement and puts the cam on top instead of pointing up your nose. The XPS 13 is available this month for $899.99.
    • The Inspiron 7000 Black Edition 2-in-1 laptop lets you hide a stylus in a dock that's in a hinge under the screen. The 13-inch and 15-inch models include Whiskey Lake chips, but more spec info will become available closer to the March launch date.
    • Dell's smartphone-linking Mobile Connect software can now transfer files to/from an Android phone, and the company demoed VR mirroring, which puts phone notifications over the VR environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • OAS

    Oasis Petroleum upgraded to Buy at Stifel on valuation

    • Oasis Petroleum (OAS +3.2%) is higher after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral and raises its price target to $14 from $10.50, saying the stock is now valued at a 9% discount to the small- and mid-cap Bakken peer group following the Q4 oil price drop.
    • Stifel's Mark Scialla says OPEC production cuts and tempered U.S. spending could drive an oil price recovery this year and looks for OAS's "valuation gap" to narrow this year.
    • Yesterday, BMO Capital downgraded OAS to Market Perform from Outperform with an $8 price target, slashed from $14, citing the firm's reduced oil price forecast of $50/bbl in 2019 and the company's "less competitive debt-adjusted growth and above-average financial leverage."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile's Legere goes on attack over 5G marketing

    • A simmering wireless war of words over the definition of "5G" -- and marketing approaches vs. standards reality -- has reached a predictable point, with T-Mobile (TMUS -0.8%) chief John Legere unloading on the "duopoly" of AT&T (T +1.2%) and Verizon (VZ +2.9%).
    • "I’ve been calling BS on all the 5G fiction that @ATT and @verizon are spewing since Day 1," Legere says amid a flurry of tweets a few minutes ago.
    • Amid criticism about AT&T's marketing of "5Ge" (based on deploying 60 MHz of LTE-A spectrum this year), Legere says the company should be ashamed. "Slapping '5Ge' on something that is actually LTE is like putting an extra 0 on a $10 bill and calling it $100 bill! #GoodLuckUsingIt"
    • It's just LTE-A, and T-Mobile has more of that than AT&T, Legere says. And he takes aim at Verizon's full-page newspaper ad, headlined "When we say '5G,' we mean 5G."
    • Verizon launched its "5G Home" service on Oct. 1, but with industry standards incomplete, Verizon's offering is a proprietary approach (5G TF) based on its millimeter-wave spectrum.
    • Meanwhile, T-Mobile is awaiting a currently shut down FCC for resumption of the review of its merger with Sprint (S -0.9%), a deal the two underdogs are counting on in order to compete in the 5G era.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 36 Comments
  • RHP

    Ryman Hospitality surges 5.3% after Raymond James upgrade

    • Ryman Hospitality (NYSE:RHP) soars 5.3% after Raymond James analyst William Crow upgraded the stock to outperform, saying the stock's decline late last year makes an "attractive entry point" and provides a 5.0% yield.
    • Stock is on track to close at its highest since Dec. 7.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 3 buys; 4 holds; 0 underperform/sells.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • EQT

    EQT announces layoffs, promises 2019 capex plans in near future

    • EQT Corp. (EQT +2.6%) reportedly laid off more than 100 people yesterday, as it cuts costs amid a power struggle at the top of the company.
    • EQT does not confirm the number of layoffs but says the action was a necessary step in its efforts to improve operational efficiency, cash flow and its financial position.
    • EQT also releases a letter to shareholders, saying it will provide more details "in the near future" about its 2019 plans to unlock the "tremendous potential of EQT’s assets."
    • The company says it intends to "achieve mid-single digit year-over-year growth combined with meaningful free cash flow, and when we announce our 2019 capital program, we will provide additional operational and financial projections."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 18 Comments
  • CLPS

    Microcaps mostly among tech movers

    • Gainers: CLPS Incorporation (NASDAQ:CLPS) +107%. VirnetX Holding (NYSEMKT:VHC) +39%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) +35%. Marin Software Incorporated (NASDAQ:MRIN) +19%. USA Technologies (NASDAQ:USAT) +14%.
    • Losers: Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) -26%. Dolphin Entertainment (NASDAQ:DLPN) -11%. Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -10%. Gravity (NASDAQ:GRVY) -7%. Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • GOOGL

    Google roundup: Assistant's busy CES19

    • Google (GOOGL +0.6%)(GOOG +0.5%) Assistant is having a busy #CES19:
    • A preview of Google Assistant Connect, a platform to help device manufacturers easily and affordably integrate Assistant.
    • With Lenovo, a new Smart Clock with a 4-inch touchscreen that gently wakes up with auto-adjusting brightness and animations. The clock can also control smart home devices. The Lenovo Smart Clock will be available in spring for $79.
    • Whirlpool (WHR +2.1%) previews the KitchenAid Smart Display with Assistant that has a 10-inch display and is water resistant for those kitchen splatters.
    • Sonos' (SONO +0.6%) One and Beam will have Assistant and older models will be updated to support the voice assistant.
    • Multiple TV integrations including Samsung's newest TVs and DISH's Hopper receivers.
    • And if your Instant Pot didn't have enough functions, the Smart WiFi Programmable Pressure Cooker has an Assistant.
    • Google says Assistant works with over 1,600 home automation brands and over 10K devices.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • VNE

    Auto parts stock rally off China, CES news

    • Auto parts stocks are in rally mode on signs of progress with the trade talks between U.S. and China officials.
    • Bloomberg reports that China is expected to increase auto purchases this year as part of the negotiations. Also in the mix is some product and partnership news from within the sector out of CES in Las Vegas.
    • Gainers include Veoneer (VNE +5.4%), Lear (LEA +5.3%), Aptiv (APTV +4.6%), Tower International (TOWR +4.2%), Autoliv (ALV +4.1%), Tenneco (TEN +4%), Visteon (VC +3.7%), Gentherm (THRM +4%), Lydall (LDL +3.3%), Stoneridge (SRI +3.5%), American Axle & Manufacturing (AXL +2.9%) and BorgWarner (BWA +2.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRP

    TransCanada seeks construction start for Keystone XL by June

    • TransCanada (TRP +1.6%) hopes to start construction by June on the Keystone XL oil pipeline project, according to a filing with the U.S. District Court in Montana that sided last month with environmental groups opposing the project and said the company could not resume field work while awaiting a new environmental review from the U.S. State Department.
    • TRP says its current schedule requires pre-construction activities including setting up pipe yards and work camps to resume by February, which would allow full work to begin by June and be completed in late 2020, with the pipeline entering service in early 2021.
    • The company also reiterates a year-long delay would cost $949M in lost profits, delay the hiring of 6,600 workers and cause higher construction costs as competition for crews increases in 2020.
    • A hearing is scheduled for Jan. 14, though the U.S. Department of Justice, which is representing the State Department in the proceedings, lacks funding due to the partial government shutdown; TRP asks the court to move forward with the hearing without the DoJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • HL

    Hecla Mining +9% as Canaccord upgrades to Buy

    • Hecla Mining (HL +8.8%) marches higher after Canaccord Genuity upgrades shares to Buy from Hold and raises its price target to $3.25 from $2.75 as the firm hikes its gold and silver price forecasts.
    • Canaccord says it remains focused on HL's integration and ramp-up of the Nevada assets over 2019, where it expects 162K oz. of gold production vs. just 35K oz. in 2018 post acquisition mid-year.
    • At the other assets, the firm forecasts largely steady-state operations but does not expect a resolution of the Lucky Friday labor dispute in 2019.
    • Canaccord predicts largely flat production and cost profiles at both Greens Creek and Casa Berardi in 2019, and anticipates further clarity on longer-term mine plans for Casa Berardi, San Sebastian and the Nevada assets over the course of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu announces new Apollo, delivery van partnership

    • Baidu's (BIDU) #CES19 announcements include new versions of its self-driving vehicle platform Apollo and an autonomous van partnership.
    • Apollo Enterprise is a new commercial brand for a suite of customizable intelligent driving products for mass production vehicles. Apollo 3.5 is the newest open source version and includes the ability to perform in complex urban and suburban driving scenarios.
    • California-based self-driving delivery van company udelv will use Apollo 3.5 to pilot up to 100 of its trial vans this year in several U.S. locations including the San Francisco Bay area.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 8 Comments
  • HEB

    Hemispherx Bio up 22% on Ampligen + Keytruda studies

    • Thinly traded nano cap Hemispherx Biopharma (HEB +22.1%) is up on a 7x surge in volume in reaction to its announcement of two clinical trials evaluating the combination of Ampligen (rintatolimod) and Merck's (MRK +0.4%) Keytruda (pembrolizumab).
    • The first will assess Ampligen when given prior to Keytruda in six triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) patients. The objective is to determine if Ampligen boosts the effectiveness of Keytruda compared to Keytruda alone. The study, to be conducted at the Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center in Buffalo, NY, should start shortly.
    • The second will evaluate the combination in 40 ovarian cancer patients at the University of Pittsburgh, also to determine if the combination outperforms Keytruda as monotherapy. It will commence later this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • EMES

    Emerge Energy Services and Adient among Energy/Materials gainers; Centrus Energy and Northern Technologies among losers

    • Gainers: Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +15%. Adient (NASDAQ:ADNT) +10%. Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) +10%. Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) +9%. VAALCO Energy (NYSE:EGY) +9%.
    • Losers: Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) -9%. Northern Technologies (NASDAQ:NTIC) -8%. CARBO Ceramics (NYSE:CRR) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • ROKU

    Roku pares losses as Citron clarifies earlier stance

    • Roku (ROKU -2.4%) has pared earlier, deeper losses on the day after Citron Research deletes a tweet where the firm called Roku "uninvestable" and posts a clarification.
    • "To clarify, we are watching $ROKU from the side," Andrew Left's firm tweeted a few minutes ago.
    • "After successfully shorting ROKU as it traded as high as $50 in late 2017, we reversed our position at $35 last year. With Apple teaming up with Sams, LG, and Vizio investors must consider the risk to the bigger story," Citron continues.
    • Shares fell as much as 10.1% earlier after Citron said "the story has changed" and to expect a big retracement. They're back up to $41.16 now.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 46 Comments
  • AAPL

    Cook: Apple "underappreciated" by Street

    • In a CNBC interview, Apple's (AAPL +2.1%) Tim Cook says the company's devices and services are "probably underappreciated" by Wall Street.
    • Key quote, on market reaction: “We sort of look through all of that. We think about the long term. And so when I look at the long-term health of the company, it has never been better. The product pipeline has never been better. The ecosystem has never been stronger. The services are on a tear.”
    • See the full interview tonight on "Mad Money" 6 PM ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 117 Comments
  • NGD

    New Gold +12% as Rainy River reports best ever quarterly production

    • New Gold (NGD +12.5%) jumps to its highest level since September after reporting improved Q4 performance at its troubled Rainy River mine in Ontario, which achieved annual revised gold production guidance.
    • NGD says Q4 Rainy River gold production rose 39% to a best-ever quarterly production of 77.2K oz. while production remained steady at its New Afton mine in British Columbia at ~18.8K oz.
    • NGD says it is deferring its 2019 underground mine development plan for Rainy River to 2020; during 2019, it plans to launch a comprehensive review that includes alternative underground mining scenarios with the overall objective of reducing capital and improving the return on investment for the underground portion of the life of mine.
    • Total company-wide gold production for Q4 was 110,559 oz. and 455,448 oz. for the full year, including 97,428 oz. and 315,483 oz., respectively, from continuing operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • JPM

    JPMorgan, SunTrust downgraded by Jefferies on lower PT multiples

    • JPMorgan (JPM -1%), SunTrust Banks (STI -0.2%), and U.S. Bancorp (USB -0.3%) are cut to hold by Jefferies analyst Ken Usdin as he trims bank share price-target multiples.
    • Removing interest-rate hikes from models is the biggest factor for Q4 estimate revisions; NII growth "should be fine."
    • He also raises Associated Banc-Corp (ASB +0.4%) to buy and sees potential in "beaten-down, low-multiple names" such as Comerica(CMA -0.3%), KeyCorp (KEY -0.6%), and Zions (ZION +0.7%). Signature Bank (SBNY +0.7%) and Sterling Bancorp (STL +0.8%) may benefit from a more dovish Fed, he writes.
    • Cuts Texas Capital Bancshares (TCBI -0.1%) to hold on concerns about mortgage warehouse concentration, credit quality, and estimate revision risk.
    • Overall, financial stocks are down. Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (NYSEARCA:XLF) slips 0.8% in early afternoon trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • HFBC

    HopFed Bancorp leads financial gainers; First Financial and Yangtze River Port and Logistics the only losers

    • Gainers: HopFed Bancorp (NASDAQ:HFBC) +35%. Reven Housing REIT (NASDAQ:RVEN) +16%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +12%. Wheeler Real Estate Investment Trust (NASDAQ:WHLR) +10%. Cushman & Wakefield (NYSE:CWK) +5%.
    • Losers: First Financial (NASDAQ:THFF) -10%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • VHC

    VirnetX +41% as Appeals Court hears patent arguments

    • VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) gains 40.7% as a panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit hears arguments regarding patent validity at the heart of VHC's case against Apple.
    • Apple is challenging the $302M infringement verdict awarded to VirnetX. VHC is challenging Patent Trial and Appeal Board decisions that its patents are invalid.
    • The panel's decision isn't expected for months.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 24 Comments
  • SYNH

    Syneos Health up 10% after corporate update

    • Syneos Health (SYNH +9.8%) is up on below-average volume following a corporate presentation at JPM19 by CEO Alistair Macdonald. Highlights:
    • Six end-to-end contracts won through 9/30/18 valued at greater than $500M. $2.7B of trailing twelve-month awards through 9/30/18. $772M of net awards through 9/30/18. On track to meet book-to-bill target of 1.1x.
    • Goal of 3x leverage by end of 2019. Fixed rate debt now ~55% of total. Ability to borrow up to $250M via A/R securitization facility.
    • $175M remains to be spent on share buybacks.
    • #JPM19
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • CLPS

    Healthcare & Tech tops midday movers

    • Gainers: CLPS Incorporation (NASDAQ:CLPS) +130%. Regional Health Properties (NYSEMKT:RHE) +48%. VirnetX Holding (NYSEMKT:VHC) +51%. HopFed Bancorp (NASDAQ:HFBC) +35%.     India's top court rules for Monsanto on GMO cotton seed patent

    • Bayer’s (OTCPK:BAYRY +2.4%) Monsanto unit wins a legal battle to own patents on genetically modified cotton seeds in India, as the country's Supreme Court rules the company’s patent for Bt cotton seeds is valid.
    • The ruling overturns a judgment by the Delhi High Court that said certain items such as seeds, plants and animals cannot be patented.
    • The ruling is a boost for Monsanto, which faced the risk of losing revenues without a claim over exclusive rights in India, and may encourage some biotech companies to revive expansion plans in India that were placed on hold amid restrictions imposed by the government and local courts in recent years.

  • CTXR

    Citius Pharma up 7% on in-license of anti-infective gel wrap

    • Thinly traded nano cap Citius Pharmaceuticals (CTXR +7.1%) is up on a healthy 47x surge in volume in reaction to its license agreement with MD Anderson Cancer Center to develop and commercialize a product called "Mino-Wrap," a gel-based wrap containing minocycline and rifampin designed to reduce post-operative infections associated with surgical implants.
    • Specifically, the product is aimed at reducing tissue expander (TE) infections following breast reconstructive surgery. A TE is a silicon implant that is placed in the mastectomy space and inflated with saline over a period of time to prepare the area for a permanent breast implant. The rate of TE-related infections is between 2.5 - 24%, depending on a range of factors such as the extent of the surgery and duration of postoperative drainage.
    • Mino-Wrap (CITI 101) is currently being evaluated in a Phase 3 study.
    • Minocycline is a tetracycline antibiotic used to treat severe acne. Rifampin is also an antibiotic, typically used to treat bacterial infections.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM

    • S&P cut the rating on PG&E and its Pacific Power & Gas unit to B from BBB-, the lowest tier of investment-grade ratings, citing political and regulatory pressure and uncertainty over its potential liabilities.

    Union Pacific soars as upgrades roll in

    • Union Pacific (NYSE:UNP) breaks higher after landing a series of upgrades off its hiring of well-known railroad exec Jim Vena as chief operating officer.
    • Investment firms giving UNP the boost today include Scotiabank (to Sector Outperform), RBC Capital (to Outperform), Seaport (to Buy) and Cowen (to Outperform, $PT to $178). Analysts covering the sector see the addition to the management team as the missing piece to the puzzle. Even without Vena pulling the levers, Union Pacific's share price return over the last 52 weeks of +2.10% ranks third best in the railroad sector out of 14 stocks, although behind both Norfolk Southern and CSX.
    • UNP +8.01% premarket to $149.74.
